column4: For Medibuntu, sudo apt-get --allow-unauthenticated install medibuntu-keyring
I don't use mediaubuntu
according to your pastebin, you have it enabled.
If I have a repo for it, it's for some other package tied to it I spose.
I assure you I have never installed it, only added those PPAs for cetain apps I wanted
For TOR, you should have followed the instructions at http://www.torproject.org/docs/debian.html.en (option 2), which would have installed the key

Again, man, I just copied my apt-get sources from one computer to another. the other computer? it all works fine. the issue is on here, I haven't added ANY keys, so how can I backup one copies keys to the other? that would be the fastest I feel.
I did follow those instructions on my laptop
it contains binary data, yes
that's how gnupg stores such things by default
have you considered just copying it over?
When attempting a sudo mv : "Failed to preserve owenrship for 'destdirwashere': Operation not permitted.
I did a sudo cp of the file to my desktop then was attempting to move it to external media.
did the copy actually fail, or was it just warning you about not preserving file permissions?
(it was only a warning by the way) : I still get GPG errors on apt-get update.
After replacing the file in /etc/apt/
replace the other files ending in .gpg in the same directory then, I guess. Ask wgrant, I'm more of the "you should readd the PPAs" school of thought.
I also set the permissions to the same as on the laptop before doing apt-get update (owner: root, read and write, group: root access none, other access none
ok
Ahh fml I missed one.
Hot damn. Boo-yah. Rocked that *censored*. YYEAAAHHH. God I love Linux - the simplest of tasks are mind-numbingly difficult.. I haven't felt this way since I was a 9 year old kid on DOS6 ;)
Rebooting this machine I'm on Jon- if you need to chat with me as well\
